benchmark_details.name: ESNLIR (Reasoning-Spanish-Natural-Language-Inference)
benchmark_details.overview: The paper introduces a novel Spanish multi-genre dataset for Natural Language Inference (NLI) that incorporates causal relationships between sentences, aiming to enhance model generalization capabilities.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide an extensive dataset for Spanish multi-genre NLI that incorporates causal relationships, enabling better evaluation and development of NLI models in Spanish.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset is primarily evaluated with BERT-based models and may require human annotation of more examples to improve quality.

data.source: 34 Spanish corpora across multiple genres including articles, books, comments, legal, clinical, news, talks, and theses.
data.size: 7,325,356 training examples, 127,404 validation examples, 128,412 test examples
data.annotation: Automated extraction using linking phrases for premise-hypothesis pairs.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy and F1 Score metrics are calculated for model performance evaluation.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy and F1 scores indicate better model performance in understanding semantic relationships.
methodology.baseline_results: XGBoost accuracy: 0.35, BERTIN accuracy: 0.663, XLMRoBERTa accuracy: 0.676.
methodology.validation: Double stratification strategy used to maintain class balance across training, validation, and testing splits.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Analysis of genre representation shows potential bias in non-formal writing categories.
